line_1: And round their mansion spreads the swelling vines.
line_2: IANTHE with fine taste the flowers combines,

line_1: Sweet Clusters, bend the fruitful Vines
line_2: Wave your tall Heads, ye lofty Pines,

line_1: Which threats their flocks, or which destroys their vines,
line_2: And which with good, or baleful aspect shines.
When Ceres led me thro' her wheaten mines!

line_1: Her unctuous olives and her purple vines,
line_2: (Unfelt the fury of those bursting mines)

line_1: The Husband Elm supports th'embracing Vines,
line_2: And round its Oak the Ivy closer twines.

line_1: And mackrel shall grow on the vines;
line_2: Or forgets to love fair Charlotte Lynes.

line_1: With warmer Rays, and chears the curling Vines?
line_2: What, tho' their more propitious PHOEBUS shines
